title: [Large-Scale] SRL-Based Critical Language Thinking Education Design for COVID-19 Crisis Response

context.prior_knowledge: Basic online learning tool proficiency, foundational language arts knowledge (grammar structure comprehension, text analysis skills)
context.additional_context: Provision of digital devices enabling student-led learning in VR/simulation environments, applying real-world problem-solving scenarios in COVID-19 contexts, and strengthening collaborative learning through linguistic expression (speaking/writing).

learning_goals: Learners will apply self-regulated learning (SRL) strategies with over 80% accuracy to derive text-based solutions in real-world COVID-19 problem scenarios
Learners will present at least three decision-making criteria demonstrating critical thinking in a multimedia game-based simulation environment using linguistic expressions (vocabulary/grammar)
Learners will use self-assessment rubrics to review their learning process, reflect on feedback in over 70% of items in reflective reports, and construct logical expression structures
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
